description: This vase epitomizes the achievements of the royal porcelain factory at Sèvres during the Napoleonic period. Commissioned by Napoleon in 1805 but produced only in 1813, this vase was still at the factory when Napoleon was exiled in 1814. It served as a diplomatic gift from his successor, King Louis XVIII, to Viscount Castlereagh, the British foreign secretary, and, later, the 2nd Marquess of Londonderry.
artist_info:
Sèvres Porcelain Manufactory (Sèvres
France, founded 1740)
Designed by Charles Percier (French, 1764–1838)
Decoration designed by Alexandre-Theodore Brogniart (French, 1739–1813)
Flowers and ornament painted by Gilbert Drouet (French, 1785–1825)
Birds painted by Christophe-Ferdinand Caron (French, active 1792–1815)
title: Londonderry Vase
